verbose_text: " Compound mutations " in DSPP (indels that maintained the reading frame) were proposed to cause the DGI-III in this group, but it was subsequently demonstrated that the dentin defects in Brandywine isolate were caused by a p.Pro17Ser missense alteration that segregated with the phenotype, caused endoplasmic reticulum retention of the protein in a functional assay (Hart and Hart 2007), and was disease causing in another DGI family (Zhang et al. 2007).
evidence: DSPP (indels that maintained the reading frame) were proposed to cause the DGI-III
